channel.title: Python on Frank's Redily

item.title: [Python] Fast Loop
item.description: In this video, James Murphy compares the performance of different ways to do loop in Python. He pointed out the fact that Python is a pretty slow programming language on its own and giving a comprehensive conclusion to what might be the fastest way to loop. To summarize, the loop is supposed to sum the numbers from 0 to n-1 (n=100_000_000). Given below is the performance of each way measured by profiling using timeit.
